item.title: 据《华盛顿邮报》报道，马斯克直接呼吁特朗普撤销新关税
item.description: 据《华盛顿邮报》周一援引两位知情人士的话报道，科技亿万富翁、特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）上周末直接呼吁美国总统唐纳德-特朗普撤销关税，但未获成功。【原文：Tech-billionaire and Tesla CEO Elon Musk made direct yet unsuccessful appeals to U.S. President Donald Trump to reverse tariffs over the past weekend, Washington Post reported on Monday citing two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 高盛预测不同情况下的布伦特和 WTI 价格
item.description: 高盛预测，根据两种假设，布伦特和 WTI 原油价格到 2025 年 12 月将分别为每桶 62 美元和 58 美元，到 2026 年 12 月将分别为 55 美元和 51 美元。【原文：Goldman Sachs forecast that Brent and WTI crude prices would be at $62 a barrel and $58 by December 2025 and at $55 and $51 by December 2026, respectively, under two assumptions.】

item.title: Tronchetti Provera 表示，倍耐力的美国业务因中化集团入股而受阻
item.description: 意大利轮胎制造商倍耐力执行副董事长马可-特隆切蒂-普罗维拉周二在接受报纸采访时说，倍耐力在美国投资遇到了困难，因为其最大股东是中国国有企业中化集团。【原文：Pirelli is having difficulties investing in the United States because its largest shareholder is China's state-owned Sinochem, the Italian tyremaker's executive vice chairman Marco Tronchetti Provera said in a newspaper interview on Tuesday.】

item.title: 高盛称市场对达成乌克兰和平协议的可能性定价为 70
item.description: 美国投资银行高盛（Goldman Sachs）称，债券定价推断市场认为达成乌克兰和平协议的可能性为 70%，与 11 月美国总统唐纳德-特朗普当选前相比大幅上升。【原文：U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs said bond pricing inferred that markets believed there was 70% probability of a Ukraine peace deal, up sharply from before the November election of U.S. President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 黄金当前的涨势：与 20 世纪 80 年代相呼应，内核更具可持续性
item.description: 黄金最近一举创下历史新高，令人不禁将其与上一次政治和经济动荡成为创纪录价格的主要推动力时（1980 年）相提并论。但市场人士表示，这次反弹的性质--以及其潜在的持续能力--看起来有所不同。【原文：Gold's latest gallop to all-time highs has drawn comparisons with the last time political and economic turmoil were the main drivers of record prices, back in 1980. But market players say the nature of this rally - and potentially its ability to endure - look different.】

item.title: 前日本外汇外交官称，特朗普不会达成 "广场协议 "式的美元协议
item.description: 日本前最高货币外交官筱原直行（Naoyuki Shinohara）周二表示，美国试图实施1985年《广场协议》式的美元协调贬值很可能行不通，因为这需要中国和欧洲的同意。【原文：Any U.S. attempt to pull off a 1985 Plaza Accord-type coordinated depreciation of the dollar likely won't work as it would require the consent of China and Europe, Japan's former top currency diplomat Naoyuki Shinohara said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 关税引发的华尔街之痛促使投资者权衡更多悲观前景
item.description: 随着投资者权衡全球贸易战可能旷日持久以及企业利润前景更加暗淡，美国股市的大幅下滑正在引发市场对更可怕局面的担忧。【原文：A dramatic U.S. stock slide is fanning fears of even more dire scenarios for the market, as investors weigh the potential for a prolonged global trade war and a much dimmer corporate profit outlook.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：中国建议申银万国不要转移供应链
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道，快速时尚零售商Shein正面临中国政府的反对，因为该公司计划将部分生产转移出中国。【原文：Fast-fashion retailer Shein is facing opposition from the Chinese government over its plans to shift some production out of the country, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 早间竞标：市场的希望之光还是假曙光？
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: TSR 统计显示，2024/25 财年日本破产申请量创 11 年新高
item.description: 信用研究机构东京商工研究公司（TSR）周二称，在日本央行加息时间表的不确定性上升之际，2024财年日本的破产申请总数达到10144件，为11年来最多。【原文：Japan's bankruptcy filings in fiscal 2024 totalled 10,144, the most in 11 years, credit research firm Tokyo Shoko Research (TSR) said on Tuesday, amid rising uncertainties around the Bank of Japan's rate hike schedule.】

item.title: 中国液化天然气买家在关税影响下转售美国货物
item.description: 贸易商和分析师说，由于针锋相对的关税推高了进口成本，中国的液化天然气买家正在转售源自美国的货物。【原文：Chinese buyers of LNG are re-selling U.S.-sourced cargoes as tit-for-tat tariffs drive up import costs, and the trend is set to accelerate as new multi-year supply deals kick in this month and domestic demand weakens, traders and analysts say.】

item.title: 中国的 DeepRoute.ai 将与高通公司合作开发先进的驾驶辅助解决方案
item.description: 中国自动驾驶技术开发商 DeepRoute.ai 周二表示，将与高通公司合作开发基于 Snapdragon 平台的 "高性价比 "高级驾驶辅助解决方案。【原文：Chinese autonomous driving technology developer DeepRoute.ai said on Tuesday it will cooperate with Qualcomm to develop "cost-effective" advanced driver assistance solutions based on Snapdragon platforms.】

item.title: 比亚迪预计第一季度净利润同比增长 86.0-118.9
item.description: 中国电动汽车巨头比亚迪周二表示，预计第一季度净利润将同比增长86.0%-118.9%。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD said on Tuesday it expects net profit in the first quarter to grow 86.0%-118.9% year-on-year.】

item.title: 日本 Seven & i 公司第四季度利润下降 24%，收购压力增大
item.description: 日本零售商 Seven & i Holdings 周三将录得 24% 的季度利润跌幅，原因是其便利店业务表现不佳，阻碍了其抵御加拿大 Alimentation Couche-Tard 公司收购企图的能力。【原文：Japanese retailer Seven & i Holdings is set to record a 24% drop in quarterly profit on Wednesday as underperformance of its convenience store business hampers its ability to fend off a takeover attempt by Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard .】

item.title: 香港领导人称香港将在美国 "无情 "关税下签署更多自由贸易协定
item.description: 香港领导人李柱铭周二表示，香港将签署更多自由贸易协定，以分散风险，因为他所称的 "无情的 "美国关税正在扰乱世界经济和贸易秩序，引发了全球贸易战。【原文：Hong Kong leader John Lee said on Tuesday the city would sign more free trade pacts to diversify its risk amid a global trade war triggered by what he called "ruthless" U.S. tariffs that he said were disrupting the world economic and trade order.】

item.title: 中国批评特朗普关税 "讹诈"，市场动荡趋于平稳
item.description: 特朗普表示，他将对中国进口商品额外征收 50%的关税。【原文：Trump said he would impose an additional 50% duty on Chinese imports.】

item.title: 澳大利亚支付公司 Zip 因 3,000 万美元的股票回购计划而大涨
item.description: 澳大利亚 Zip 公司宣布了一项高达 5000 万澳元（3010 万美元）的股票回购计划，该计划将于 4 月 23 日左右开始实施，随后该公司股价周二上涨超过 8%。【原文：Shares of Australia's Zip rose more than 8% on Tuesday after the "buy-now, pay-later" firm announced a share buyback plan of up to A$50 million ($30.1 million), with the programme set to begin around April 23.】

item.title: 尽管有美国关税担忧，新西兰仍将坚持当前的经济计划
item.description: 新西兰财政部长尼古拉-威利斯（Nicola Willis）周二表示，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税计划引发了全球金融市场的动荡，但新西兰不会修改其经济和财政计划。【原文：New Zealand will not revise its economic and fiscal plans despite the turmoil in the global financial markets triggered by U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff plans, Finance Minister Nicola Willis said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 日本引领亚洲股市反弹，收益率因贸易乐观情绪而上升
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市从1-1/2年的低点反弹，美股期货走高，市场在近期因希望华盛顿可能愿意就其部分激进关税进行谈判而遭遇大量抛售之后喘了口气。【原文：Asian stocks bounced off 1-1/2-year lows and U.S. stock futures pointed higher on Tuesday, as markets caught their breath after recent heavy selling on hopes that Washington might be willing to negotiate some of its aggressive tariffs.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，CVS Health 的财务主管将辞职
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，CVS Health Corp 首席财务官托马斯-考黑（Thomas Cowhey）打算卸任。【原文：CVS Health Corp Chief Financial Officer Thomas Cowhey intends to step down from his position, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 调查显示：关税动荡前，澳大利亚 3 月份商业活动基本稳定
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策引发动荡之前，澳大利亚3月份的商业活动基本保持不变，而信心则进一步下滑至负值。【原文：A measure of Australian business activity was largely unchanged in March before the turmoil from U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs hit, a survey showed on Tuesday, while confidence dipped further into negative territory.】

item.title: 美元脆弱不堪，交易员在关税动荡中寻找避风港
item.description: 周二，避险货币日元和瑞士法郎维持在六个月高点附近，而美元则普遍下跌，因为在唐纳德-特朗普总统全面征收关税之后，金融市场正努力应对日益加剧的经济衰退忧虑。【原文：The safe havens yen and Swiss franc held near six-month highs on Tuesday while the U.S. dollar nursed broad losses as financial markets grappled with mounting recession worries in the wake of President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs.】

item.title: 日本任命经济大臣赤泽负责与美国的贸易谈判
item.description: 日本政府最高发言人周二表示，日本经济大臣赤泽亮世已被任命为与美国的贸易谈判代表。【原文：Japan's Economy Minister Ryosei Akazawa has been appointed as trade negotiator with the United States, the government's top spokesperson said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 油价在美国关税重挫后攀升 1
item.description: 由于担心美国关税可能抑制需求并导致全球经济衰退，油价在最近几个交易日大幅下挫后反弹，周二涨幅超过 1%。【原文：Oil prices rose more than 1% on Tuesday, rebounding after a hefty selloff in recent sessions led by concerns that U.S. tariffs might depress demand and lead to a global recession.】

item.title: 中国国有企业誓言增加股票购买以平息市场波动
item.description: 周二，中国多家国有控股公司誓言增加股票投资，同时多家上市公司宣布回购股票，中国政府正加大力度稳定受美国关税困扰的股市。【原文：Several Chinese state holding companies vowed on Tuesday to increase share investment while a slew of listed companies announced share buybacks as Beijing stepped up efforts to stabilise a stock market rocked by U.S. tariff woes.】

item.title: 越南将购买美国防务和安全产品以解决贸易差额问题
item.description: 越南总理范明正周一晚些时候发表声明称，越南将购买更多美国商品，包括国防和安全产品，并要求美国推迟45天征收关税。【原文：Vietnam will buy more American goods, including defence and security products, and has asked for a 45-day delay in the imposition of U.S. tariffs, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh said in a statement issued late on Monday.】

item.title: 受美国科技股提振，日本日经指数跳涨 6%，从 1 年半低点反弹
item.description: 由于当地交易商评估了美国科技股的强劲表现，日本日经平均指数周二大涨 6%，从上一交易日创下的 1 年半低点反弹。【原文：Japan's Nikkei share average rose 6% on Tuesday in a widespread rally, rebounding from a 1-1/2-year low hit in the previous session, as local traders assessed strong performances of U.S. technology stocks.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比表示，人们对关税忧心忡忡
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周一表示，企业对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策感到焦虑，但央行在采取政策应对措施时需要看 "硬数据"。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Austan Goolsbee on Monday said businesses are anxious about U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs but that the central bank would need to look at "hard data" in its policy response.】

item.title: 塔斯社报道：俄罗斯法院对拒绝删除反政府内容的 Telegram 应用程序处以罚款
item.description: 据塔斯社周二报道，莫斯科一家法院对 Telegram 平台处以 700 万卢布（约合 8 万美元）的罚款，原因是该平台拒绝删除呼吁发动恐怖袭击和参与旨在推翻俄罗斯政府的抗议活动的内容。【原文：A Moscow court fined the Telegram platform 7 million roubles ($80,000) for refusing to remove content calling for terrorist attacks and participation in protests aiming to overthrow the Russian government, news agency TASS reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: PNC Financial任命贝莱德前高管为总裁
item.description: PNC 金融服务集团周一任命前贝莱德高管 Mark Wiedman 为总裁，立即生效。【原文：PNC Financial Services Group on Monday appointed former BlackRock executive Mark Wiedman as president, effective immediately.】
